授業目的: The purpose of this course is to equip students with an understanding of organizational behavior concepts, theories, and their application in organizations. Organizational behavior deals with issues related to human behavior and interpersonal relationships of people within an organization. Students may engage in some organizations and play the roles as owners, managers, or employees. They should understand how people behave in an organizational setting and acquire the skills to improve organizational relationships and effectiveness. This course will help students to pursue this goal.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
a) Understand the concepts and theories of Organizational Behavior (OB)
b) Identify and evaluate contemporary OB challenges faced by managers.
c) Comprehend OB from three levels: the individual, the group, and the organization.
d) Apply the theories of OB to analyze the organizational environment and solve case studies.
e) Facilitate group discussions and team work on issues relevant to OB.
f) Communicate their findings clearly and effectively using a variety of media.
